intro: Peratanthe cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found near water sources. Due to its unique nocturnal blooming habit, it is of interest to both botanists and horticulturists.
